Can Dogs Carry Lice? While it is rare, dogs can carry lice. However it is not the same lice that humans get. Human lice need human blood to survive, dog lice need dog blood, and so on. Therefore, if your child comes home from school with a diagnosis of head lice, your dog, cat, or other pets in the household are not at risk from catching the lice or hatching eggs. Conversely, while not as common in dogs and cats, the species of lice that live on dogs and cats are not able to live on humans.

Head lice. Overview Head lice: This magnified picture of head lice on a fine-tooth comb shows that these bugs are tiny. Having head lice does not mean you are dirty. Most people get head lice when they have head-to-head contact with someone who has head lice. Head-to-head contact lets the lice crawl from one head to another head.
